Updated November     pm



img1After suffering a neck injury while vacationing during Spring Break senior Larry Busch remains in a Costa Rican hospital paralyzed from the chest down PERIOD

Meanwhile his friends and fellow members of his fraternity Zeta Psi have refocused all their philanthropy efforts on aiding his transportation back to the United States which is estimated by his sister to be as much as  PERIOD

While playing with his friends on Flamingo Beach in Costa Rica last Thursday Busch was tossed by a wave landing on his head at an angle that shattered a vertebrae in his neck PERIOD

No alcohol played a part in Buschs accident Faris said PERIOD

It was a freak accidentIts something you hear about too often but it never happens to you.They got him up the beach and at that point he was still able to move his armsBut Busch was saying Im hurt Im hurt.We had people talking him through deep breathsAt that point none of us knew the extent of his injuries .. PERIOD it was terrifying.Larry is still LarryRight now he is on a ventilator so he cant speak  but hes still himself.Its going to be a while before they can tell .. PERIOD it really is an extensive injuryAt this point theyre going to be very happy if he has full function of his arms.Theres not a realistic time frame at this pointWere hanging in there.Finding out that you may never walk again is an emotional time for him and his familyTheir support network is here and thats where he needs to be.There wasnt really any doubt in my mind that we should do this for Larrystrength.If anythings going to get him through this its mental and physical toughnessThe Larry Busch Group. reach Daily reporter Jen Ludington at urlmailtojenludingtonthedaily.washington.edujenludingtonthedaily.washington.eduurl
